text:
Not gracious at all - noise and air pollution to residents living nearby. Outdoor activities with blasting speakers of karaoke / getai, auctions, chanting and gongs banging (sometimes, at the same time) from evening till after 10.30pm!! Loud shouts of "Yum Seng" & "Huat Ah" make us wonder if it is also a night-club ... serving alcohol?

Hope the temple leaders will be more
considerate and let the residents live in a peaceful, respectful environment. We have been tolerant but find it very difficult to keep suffering in silence.

I went there on the  5 Mar 2017 (Jingzhe @ 1733 hrs) to pray Hu Yeh
as my Chinese zodiac clash (snake 41 yrs). It has a comprehensive temporary set-up (behind) the original temple built-up. I suppose its meant for praying Tai Sui and Hu Yeah season only. Anyway there is quite a following of people there praying Hu Yeh (White Tiger) against misfortunes etc.
Inconsiderate of the residents living nearby. Events finish 12+mn and most of the time 10+ 11.. hopefully one day will hv ppl to take note of this..
I have been here multiple times by now and my statement still stands strong. Such kind people.
It's a good place to say goodbye, it's quite popular.
